eu.linksmart.policy.pdp
Interface PdpAdmin

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
public interface PdpAdmin
extends java.rmi.Remote

Policy Decision Point (PDP) administrator interface The PDP administrator exposes policy CRUD functionalities, and functionalities to activate and deactivate policies. Additionally, it exposes functionalities to set generic properties in the PDP administrator implementation itself. There are currently no mandatory properties that must be handled by implementing classes. PdpAdmin implementations must throw a RemoteException whenever any of the causing errors specified in the method descriptions given below occur. Server-side Throwables may be returned as part of those exceptions. If an exception is thrown, the requested operation may not be carried out server-side. PdpAdminError enumerates those errors and should be used to throw RemoteExceptions server-side and to parse them client-side.

Author:
Michael Crouch, Marco Tiemann
See Also:
PdpAminErrors

Method Detail

activatePolicy

boolean activatePolicy(java.lang.String thePolicyId)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Activates the argument policy

Parameters:
thePolicyId - the policy ID to activate
Returns:
true if the argument policy has been activated or was already activated before that method call false if not and no specific exception is thrown
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - PdpAdminError.PDP_ADMIN_INTERNAL_ERROR if the PDP administrator is not in a working state PdpAdminError.POLICY_NOT_FOUND if no policy could be found for the argument ID any non-PDP-admin RemoteException that is thrown

deactivatePolicy

boolean deactivatePolicy(java.lang.String thePolicyId)
                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Deactivates the argument policy

Parameters:
thePolicyId - the policy ID to deactivate
Returns:
true if the argument policy has been deactivated or was already deactivated before that method call false if not and no specific exception is thrown
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - PdpAdminError.PDP_ADMIN_INTERNAL_ERROR if the PDP administrator is not in a working state PdpAdminError.POLICY_NOT_FOUND if no policy could be found for the argument ID any non-PDP-admin RemoteException that is thrown

getPolicy

java.lang.String getPolicy(java.lang.String thePolicyId)
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns the policy XML String

Parameters:
thePolicyId - the policy ID
Returns:
the policy XML String, never null or a malformed String
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - PdpAdminError.PDP_ADMIN_INTERNAL_ERROR if the PDP administrator is not in a working state PdpAdminError.POLICY_NOT_FOUND if no policy could be found for the argument ID PdpAdminError.POLICY_NOT_VALID if an invalid policy was found any non-PDP-admin RemoteException that is thrown

getActivePolicyList

java.lang.String[] getActivePolicyList()
                                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns:
the list of active policies, an empty list if no active policies are present
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - PdpAdminError.PDP_ADMIN_INTERNAL_ERROR if the PDP administrator is not in a working state any non-PDP-admin RemoteException that is thrown

getInActivePolicyList

java.lang.String[] getInActivePolicyList()
                                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns:
the list of inactive policies, an empty list if no active policies are present
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - PdpAdminError.PDP_ADMIN_INTERNAL_ERROR if the PDP administrator is not in a working state any non-PDP-admin RemoteException that is thrown

publishPolicy

boolean publishPolicy(java.lang.String thePolicyId,
                      java.lang.String thePolicy)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Publishes a policy to the PDP policy repository

Parameters:
thePolicyId - the policy ID
thePolicy - the policy XML String
Returns:
true iff the argument policy has been published, false if not and no specific exception is thrown
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - PdpAdminError.PDP_ADMIN_INTERNAL_ERROR if the PDP administrator is not in a working state PdpAdminError.POLICY_ID_ALREADY_TAKEN if the argument policy ID is already taken PdpAdminError.POLICY_NOT_VALID if the argument policy is not a valid XACML policy any non-PDP-admin RemoteException that is thrown

removePolicy

boolean removePolicy(java.lang.String thePolicyId)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Removes a policy from the PDP policy repository

Parameters:
thePolicyId - the policy ID to remove
Returns:
true if the argument policy has been removed or was not there in the first place false if not and no specific exception is thrown
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - PdpAdminError.PDP_ADMIN_INTERNAL_ERROR if the PDP administrator is not in a working state any non-PDP-admin RemoteException that is thrown

getProperty

java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String theKey)
                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Parameters:
theKey - the property key
Returns:
the property value, may be null iff the property is supported and has been set to null
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - PdpAdminError.PDP_ADMIN_INTERNAL_ERROR if the PDP administrator is not in a working state PdpAdminError.PROPERTY_NOT_SUPPORTED if the property is not supported by the implementation any non-PDP-admin RemoteException that is thrown

setProperty

boolean setProperty(java.lang.String theKey,
                    java.lang.String theValue)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Parameters:
theKey - the property key
theValue - the property value
Returns:
true iff the argument property has been set, false in any other case
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - PdpAdminError.PDP_ADMIN_INTERNAL_ERROR if the PDP administrator is not in a working state PdpAdminError.PROPERTY_NOT_SUPPORTED if the property is not supported by the implementation any non-PDP-admin RemoteException that is thrown
